subject: Sleep
title: A Cold Room Is Always Best for Sleep
description: A 60-second lesson on A Cold Room Is Always Best for Sleep.

hook.text: Sleep experts say keep your room at 65Â°F. But this specific number ignores individual variation and context.

buildup.text: A core body temperature drop does initiate sleep. Cooler environments can facilitate this thermoregulation.

discovery.text: The ideal temperature range is 60 to 68Â°F for most adults, but personal preference and bedding matter enormously.

twist.text: Elderly people and thin individuals may sleep worse in cold rooms because they lose body heat too quickly.

climax.text: A warm bath before bed is more effective than room temperature because it triggers rapid peripheral heat loss.

punchline.text: Cool rooms help, but the perfect temperature is personal, not universal.
